name: Jimgur
tagline: A jQuery plugin for interacting with the imgur.com API
body: JImgur ====== A javascript client for interacting with the imgur.com API version 3. Built using a publish/subscribe pattern. ##TODO Check out the issue list and feel free to send in a pull request. ##Examples ###Subscribe Subscribe takes a channel name, which is completely up to you what to call it. ```javascript "myChannelName" ``` The second parameter is ajax configuration parameters. These are required fields. ```javascript { clientID: 'YOUR_CLIENT_ID', name: "image", id: "aWabySL" } ``` The last parameter is a callback function, typically you would use this to manipulate the page. ```javascript function() { //what do you want to do with the data once you get it? var response = JSON.parse(this.channels["image"]["response"]) $("#example1").html(''); } ``` Put it all together: ```javascript Jimgur.subscribe( "myChannelName", //give it a name to refer to your calls { clientID: 'YOUR_CLIENT_ID', name: "image", id: "aWabySL" }, //object literal that says what you want to get from imgur function() { //what do you want to do with the data once you get it? var response = JSON.parse(this.channels["image"]["response"]) $("#example1").html(''); } ); ``` ###Fetch Refresh the data from the API: ```javascript Jimgur.fetch("myChannelName") ``` Each call to this replaces imgur's response in the channel object. ###Publish Execute your callback functions you subscribed to: ```javascript Jimgur.publish("myChannelName") ``` ###Unsubscribe Remove all objects in a channel. ```javascript Jimgur.unsubscribe("myChannelName") ``` Returns false if not found.
